channel.title: Some questions about PI (Deathlypvpz V4)
channel.description:
1.) I added a fast pk set to a random box (name is Strange Box) Now i want to change the name from the Strange Box how can i do this?
2.) I also added penguins with loads of hp and now i want them to drop Crystal Keys and Coins. How can i add this? (NPCdrops.tsm isnt working)
3.) How can i change the amount of dung tokens which a item costs? (Rapier from 2k to 1,5k for example)
4.) At edge there is 1 mirror missing. How can i add it? (objectmanager.java)

item.title: Some questions about PI (Deathlypvpz V4)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

  1. ActionHandler under firstclickobject. Get the object ID and post the code that is in the switch statement for said object.

  2. NPCDrops aren’t always added to the .tsm, sometimes you need to add it to the .java

  3. Edit your ShopAssistant.java, find the item ID’s in the special shop price (huge switch statement). Looks like:
    case ItemIDHere:
    reutrn cost;

  4. Remove the line(s) from objectmanager, some objects take up 1 or more spaces, so people just put a -1 for each one, look for close to similar coords for the mirror and remove them (Within 1 x or y value).

Read full topic

item.description:
@rspscode wrote:

Driman Rune:

What if it isn’t the write line, vain_. :facepalm:

It is the right line, coords are same.

Should i delete it?

EDIT:
Deleted the line with the correct coords but mirror is still missing?

Read full topic

item.title: Some questions about PI (Deathlypvpz V4)
item.dc:creator: @rspscode rspscode
item.description:
@rspscode wrote:

[quote=“Driman Rune, post:2, topic:527493”]1 - client sided

2- your source is better off in the recycle bin (unless you fix it).

3- example):(in shopassistant.java)

case 4151://whip code return 40;// 40 dung points

^- Not sure :/, haven’t touched a PI for a month.

4- This is probably client sided, but ook in objectmanager.java and asearch for anythign witha -1, and any near coords of edgeville.

Hope I helped.[/quote]
Ty ye i found something with -1 in objectmanager and it has the correct coords. What should i do now?

Read full topic
